title: Tawakkol Karman  |  Archives of Women's Political Communication

quotes: Karman was born on February 7, 1979, in Ta'izz, Yemen.
In 2005, Karman co-founded Women Journalists Without Chains
From 2007 to 2011, Karman organized protests against the regime of President Ali Abdullah Saleh
culminating in her leadership with the Arab Spring movement in 2011.
co-recipient of the 2011 Nobel Peace Prize
Nobel Peace Prize Acceptance Speech – Dec. 10, 2011

organizations.name: University of Science and Technology in Sana’a

earned a bachelor’s degree in commerce and a graduate degree in political science from the University of Science and Technology in Sana’a

quotes: a master's degree in international security from the University of Massachusetts Lowell

organizations.name: Women Journalists Without Chains
quotes: In 2005, Karman co-founded Women Journalists Without Chains, an organization that advocates for journalists’ rights and documents human rights abuses against Yemeni journalists and writers.
